Articles.Content: My right click button suddenly works badly. It's like it beeing held down or locked to certain parts. I have to click it repeatedly in order to get my curser back. It really annoying, especially at critical states in the mission. It started like a month or two ago. Any ideas what going on..?? Like this

Hey there! 1.0.5 added a new feature to lock the camera to the mouse when double-right-clicking, you may be noticing this. In Settings there is an option called "Double Click Mouse Look", try turning it off to see if that helps.

Also moved to Gameplay Questions.

There are two other things that can be happening, which I'd guess are probably interconnected:

Mouse input is over-sensitive, so mininsule hand movement while right-clicking is interpreted as click and drag. I've had this happen under Windows on a fresh sandbox game, just because the PC in question is the definition of slow and unresponsive due to who-knows-what background processes hogging the system.

As the game slows down to deal with all the junk you put up into space, high part-count vessels, proximity to other bodies and so on, it starts missing clicks and/or generally reading your mouse input buffer badly. It therefore reads a click and a mouse movement as happening at the same time (even though it was separated by a significant amount of time) and thinks you're trying to click-and-drag the view.

Hopefully the second problem will be sorted in 1.1. In the meantime, you could maybe try turning down mouse sensitivity (so that it doesn't register a shaky hand as being a click-and-drag). Otherwise you just have to be super slow and careful. I'm not even sure you can turn off the (single) right-click-and-drag function.
